## Old Collections Metadata

Below is the code used to generate the table showing the metadata associated with the museum collections specimens using the gt package

https://www.rstudio.com/blog/great-looking-tables-gt-0-2/
https://gt.rstudio.com/reference/gtsave.html
https://gt.rstudio.com/reference/tab_options.html

```{r}

library(tidyverse)
webshot::install_phantomjs()
library(webshot)
library(gt)
Loc_data <- read.csv("LocationData.csv")


Loc_data %>% 
  gt(groupname_col = "Species") %>% 
  tab_header(
    title = md("Metadata of Museum Collection Specimens")
  ) %>%
  cols_align(align = "center") %>%
  tab_options(
    row_group.background.color = "azure3"
  ) %>%
  gtsave("OC_MetaData.pdf")
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
